sys_metadata_link.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="09ff3d105f231000b12e3572f2b4775d" table="x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1"> <x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1 action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <active>true</active> <activity_due/> <additional_assignee_list/> <approval>not requested</approval> <approval_history/> <approval_set/> <ars_id display_value="ARS 3.1">43903e93dbcd1010280df36f299619aa</ars_id> <assessment_methods_and_objects>Examine: Personnel security policy; pr</assessment_methods_and_objects> <assessment_objective>Determine if the organization has implemented all elements of this control as described in the control statements and implementation standard(s).</assessment_objective> <assigned_to/> <assignment_group/> <assurance/> <baseline/> <business_duration/> <business_service/> <calendar_duration/> <close_notes/> <closed_at/> <closed_by/> <cmdb_ci/> <comments/> <comments_and_work_notes/> <company/> <contact_type/> <contract/> <control_definition>The organization ensures that individuals accessing an information system processing, storing, or transmitting information requiring special protection:a. Have valid access authorizations that are demonstrated by assigned official government duties; andb. Satisfy additional personnel screening periodically, consistent with the sensitivity of the information being accessed.</control_definition> <control_family display_value="Personnel Security">8a873dfcdb211010280df36f2996190b</control_family> <control_name>Information with Special Protection Measures</control_name> <control_number>PS-03(03)</control_number> <control_type>Non-Mandatory</control_type> <correlation_display/> <correlation_id/> <delivery_plan/> <delivery_task/> <description/> <due_date/> <escalation>0</escalation> <expected_start/> <follow_up/> <group_id>PS-03</group_id> <group_list/> <high>false</high> <impact>3</impact> <implementation_standards/> <knowledge>false</knowledge> <location/> <low>false</low> <made_sla>true</made_sla> <moderate>false</moderate> <number>ARSC0011105</number> <opened_at>2020-06-19 13:21:28</opened_at> <opened_by display_value="System Administrator">6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441</opened_by> <order/> <parent/> <priority>1</priority> <reassignment_count>0</reassignment_count> <reference_policy>Code: 5 C.F.R. ยง731.106; FedRAMP Rev. 4 Baseline; OMB Memo: 16-04; 45 C.F.R. ยง164.308(a)(3)(ii)(B)</reference_policy> <rejection_goto/> <related_controls>AR-5</related_controls> <service_offering/> <short_description/> <sla_due/> <standard>NIST-800</standard> <state>1</state> <supplemental_guidance>Guidance for systems processing, storing, or transmitting PII (to include PHI):  Access to sensitive information, such as personally identifiable information (PII) and protected health information (PHI), requires both a valid need to know as documented by an access authorization request, and requires a background investigation (or appropriate screening) to ensure the individual being provided access is suitable.  Guidance for systems processing, storing, or transmitting PHI:  Under the HIPAA Security Rule, this is an addressable implementation specification. HIPAA covered entities must conduct an analysis as described at 45 C.F.R. ยง 164.306 (Security standards: General rules) part (d) (Implementation specifications) to determine how it must be applied within the organization.</supplemental_guidance> <sys_class_name>x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1</sys_class_name> <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2020-06-19 13:21:28</sys_created_on> <sys_domain>09ff3d105f231000b12e3572f2b4775d</sys_domain> <sys_domain_path>!!!/!!!/</sys_domain_path> <sys_id>4a873dfcdb211010280df36f29961911</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2020-06-19 13:21:28</sys_updated_on> <task_for/> <time_worked/> <upon_approval>proceed</upon_approval> <upon_reject>cancel</upon_reject> <urgency>3</urgency> <user_input/> <variables/> <watch_list/> <wf_activity/> <work_end/> <work_notes/> <work_notes_list/> <work_start/> </x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1> </record_update>
